message.content: Some of the biggest challenges seniors in Panama face include limited access to healthcare, social isolation and loneliness, financial constraints, and age discrimination. Many seniors struggle to afford quality healthcare and face difficulties in accessing necessary medications and treatments. Social isolation is also a significant issue, as seniors may lack companionship and social connections, leading to loneliness and mental health concerns. Financial constraints are common, as a significant portion of seniors rely on limited pensions or have inadequate savings to cover their expenses. Additionally, age discrimination can be a challenge, particularly in terms of employment opportunities and societal attitudes towards aging.
